meanings.definition: smear or rub with oil, typically as part of a religious ceremony
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest anointed the newborn baby with oil.
meanings.sent2: She anointed her hands with lotion to keep them soft.
meanings.sent3: The chef anointed the salad with a drizzle of olive oil.
meanings.sent4: The artist anointed the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing it to life.
meanings.sent5: The gardener anointed the plants with fertilizer to help them grow strong.

meanings.definition: officially designate (someone) as a successor or leader
meanings.sent1: The king anointed his eldest son as the heir to the throne.
meanings.sent2: The company anointed a new CEO to lead the business into the future.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly anointed the class clown as the leader of the group project.
meanings.sent4: The coach anointed the star player as the team captain, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent5: The council anointed the mayor as the official spokesperson for the town.

meanings.definition: chosen or consecrated for a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: The anointed leader led the community with wisdom and grace.
meanings.sent2: The anointed singer captivated the audience with her beautiful voice.
meanings.sent3: The anointed cake was the highlight of the party, everyone wanted a slice.
meanings.sent4: The anointed champion emerged victorious in the fierce competition.
meanings.sent5: The anointed artist's work was displayed in galleries around the world.
